summary: okay so there’s this kids book i read while visiting a family friend with a small kid and here’s what the first page says,,, “On...
question: okay so there’s this kids book i read while visiting a family friend with a small kid and here’s what the first page says,,, “On the night you were born, the moon smiled with such wonder that the stars peeked in to see you and the night wind whispered ‘Life will never be the same,’ because there had never been anyone like you... ever in the world.” And you can get the book personalized to say “On the night you were born *insert baby’s name*...” NOW JUST IMAGINE THAT BUT WITH HARRY 😭💕💞💓💗💖💘
answer:
harry swears he’s never been this excited and nervous.

his hands are steady and so are his fingers but his heart really isn’t, and the little story book he’s grasping was ruining him in more ways than one and he couldn’t stop tearing up.

“can’t wait to read this to her.”

he whispers underneath his breath enough for his missus to hear and they made their guesses prior to them getting an ultrasound awhile ago (he swears he thinks it’s a girl because you’re blooming and glowing), but the ob-gyne said it couldn’t be known yet with the position so maybe he came home a little bummed yet nonetheless, still happy knowing the bub’s healthy.

he’s bought this the moment the both of you learned there was a little angel on the way, and he’s never really opened it all the way in until now and it was monumental for him when he would — so he decides to do it now.

and harry’s tearing up.

“s’a girl.”

his head lifts at what you’ve said and there you’re holding the little piece of paper your doctor gave you secretly as you planned to surprise him a bit more extravagantly, but it only came down to the both of you just being in your room watching whatever and you fixing up while he organizes things, and it’s domesticity at best as you think of it.

harry takes the paper from you and there he sees the four-lettered word scribbled hastily yet prettily on the paper, and his heart never dropped this low as he’s grinning, all while because of this story book he’s holding and his missus encapsulated in his embrace.

“can’t believe m’gonna be a dad now.”

blog.description:
This is a modern day pirates roleplay based in an AU world where pirates have always run rampant and royalty still exists in the six continents. After the royals put new laws into effect that would jail or execute all pirates, the pirates decided to take the law into their own hands. to get back at the royals, six pirate ships all owned by one fearless captain and his family has kidnapped the royal heirs and taken them to a private island where they can be stowed away, hidden.

summary: Late night talks with harry telling you who much he loves you and how he wants to marry you and have kids with you and all that...
question: Late night talks with harry telling you who much he loves you and how he wants to marry you and have kids with you and all that fluff things 💕
answer:
“You’re still awake?”

His voice echoed around the dark room, as you stared at the ceiling. You gave in a sigh and turned towards his figure, it was dark, and you could barely see his face, but you knew he was there.

“Couldn’t sleep.” You whispered.

You heard ruffling noises from the duvet as well as the cushions and felt his arm lazily wrapped on your waist. You cuddled him more, allowing you to smell his cologne that started to go away after a long day of work.

“Have you ever thought about future?” He asked.

Your eyebrows furrowed at his question, you never thought about it.

“Future? What future?”

“Our future.” He whispered, it was even barely a word.

You let out a shaky breathe, you thought about it every single time, but you were too scared on the challenges that you were gonna face in this relationship.

“Wanna marry you someday.” His words made you fist his shirt, your eyes getting watery as you thought about walking down the aisle with the love of your life in front, waiting for you.

“You do?” You croaked out.

Harry chuckled, he knew that you easily get emotional when talking about marriage, because he knows that you want to get married so badly.

“I do, I could do it in a heartbeat.”

“We could have children.” You whispered, he noticed the tone of your voice, he knew you were scared about telling him that topic, since you know that he was not ready yet.

Harry chuckled as he felt your heartbeat going quicker and quicker, nervous on what about he’s gonna answer.

“We could, but after we get married.” You laughed beside him, those words were music through your ears, you wouldn’t get tired of hearing it everyday.

“Love you.” You hugged him tightly. He closed his eyes, and kissed your hairline.

“I love you too.”

summary: Month Six: Twenty Three Weeks With thanks to: Beta writer @whoopsharrystyles / Pregnancy Stuff @geenalovesthelittlethings / and...
caption:
Month Six: Twenty Three Weeks

With thanks to:

Beta writer @whoopsharrystyles / Pregnancy Stuff @geenalovesthelittlethings / and for listening to me for months @all-the-love-harold

masterpost / Update 8pm aest every two-three days

M+ RATING // Language and sexual references

Evie’s outfit for this chapter.

.-.-.-.

“We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.” ― Oscar Wilde, Lady Windermere’s Fan

Grocery shopping had become much more difficult now that I was pregnant. I felt much more pressured and aware of what I was putting in my body and passing on to Nora. Albeit it was much, much easier when I didn’t have Harry two steps behind me reminding me that I couldn’t eat whatever I set my eyes on.

We always made our trips to the grocery store early in the morning, when the aisles were dead and the only people lingering were the few other early risers and the staff who looked like they wished they were still at home in their warm beds. It made it easier so we weren’t pictured by fans or any paparazzi.

My pregnancy was still a secret between us and our closest friends and family. It was a surprise because I had been in the crowd at all of his European shows and there were a number of pictures being shared of me being there, curious as to why I was at so many shows and what was going on between us, but no one had commented on my belly. I had managed to hide it beneath loose dark shirts and cardigans and the dark arena also massively helped but there was still that one perfectly timed picture where the bump was quite visible and there were a few rumours that were quickly overshadowed by something Harry had done on stage that night.

Picking up a little tub of a cheese dip from the fridge I smiled at the fond memory the spurted at the front of my mind.

Harry pulled the cold cheese dip from my hand and put it back into the fridge, vehemently ignoring the glare I shot at him. “You can’t eat that. It’s bad for Nora.”

 

Leaning forward I picked it back up and swerved away from Harry and his big hands as he tried to take it from me again, a daring smirk stretching his beautiful pink lips. He pressed himself up against my back, the warmth from his body somehow seeping through my jacket and against my skin. The heat reminded me of what he had woken me up with only an hour ago and I felt my cheeks erupt with warmth.

 

“Put the cheese down.” He murmured into my ear, teeth nipping lightly as he squeezed my hips.

 

Ignoring the scolding heat of him I lifted the little tub of cheese up and put my finger on one of the ingredients displayed on the packaging and held it up close to him so he could see it. “Pasteurised milk. It’s fine.”

 

“Evie,” Harry frowned against my ear and tried to grab it from me again but I twisted out of his reach and clutched the cool cheese to my chest in protection. I wanted cheese and I was going to have it. “It’s still not healthy.”

 

“I’m pregnant and hungry. Don’t mess with my cheese.” He shook his head and smiled loving at me, hand reaching out to take the cheese so he could put it in the trolley for me.

 

Shaking my head, I stuck my tongue out and kept walking up the aisle, one hand holding my cheese to my chest while the other caressed over my belly as Nora started to kick. I heard Harry chuckle quietly. “Swear I won’t put it back Eve’s. Just don’t want you to make it warm holding onto it.” Pursing my lips, I turned to look back at him. His hand was still out, slowly I passed it over to him, keeping my eyes on him till he dropped it into the baby seat of the trolley where I could see it clearly. “You’re lucky I love you.”

 

“Well I love cheese.” I had almost gotten to the end of the aisle when Harry snuck up behind me his hands tickling my sides.

 

I laughed hard, trying to twist out of his hold but he just looped his arms around my waist completely to pull me into him, his lips silencing my laugh. He kissed me heavily, right in the middle of the grocery store despite his own words to keep PDA non-existent, his hands sliding from my hips to cup my ass in his hands.

 

“I love you,” he whispered against my lips, still caressing them lightly with his own.

 

“I love you too, though I think you made me pee a little.” Harry laughed lightly and I crossed my legs a little, trying to fight off laughing again.

I chuckled as I slipped the new tub of cheese into my basket. Somehow Harry and I had become closer after the last few weekends. I thought that we were close before but somehow after one night, with love declarations and some great sex, we were like one. I couldn’t explain but I had never felt so right. My life had never felt so perfect and moving in the right direction despite the little detour of Nora. I felt a way that I never had with Luke. I had never been even a fraction close to real love with Luke now that I knew what it was like to truly love Harry.

I sighed deeply as I continued up the aisles. Harry was leaving for a few weeks and I had already felt so lost just thinking about him going. He was sat on my couch at home talking over some last-minute things with Jeff but already I missed him so much. He was also a little annoyed that I wasn’t going to go with him on the next two legs of the tour but Australia seemed a little too far away if something were to go wrong.

I would be fine without him. I had Anne and Gemma in London with me and Grace every few weeks when she flew back from New York, but they didn’t compare to Harry. Harry was always the one I talked to. For years he was the one that I called first when I just needed to talk. Even when I was with Luke I would rather talk to Harry.

When I got home for the hospital after my parents died I left Luke asleep in my bed, snoring his head off while I snuck downstairs, Harry’s number already dialled on my phone. I sat outside talking to him on my back deck until the sun rose behind the trees. Then I didn’t think it was a bad thing but now I realised if it was Harry that he been in my bed that night and not Luke, he wouldn’t have fallen asleep, he would have stayed awake peppering my neck with kisses and letting me talk until I fell asleep in his arms.

“Evie,” the voice was soft, the gentlest tone I had ever heard leave his mouth, but the single word was still laced with shock.

My chest tightened incredibly and I had to reach out my hand to steady myself on one of the shelves. I knew that voice, it was a voice that I loved and still leaves me trembling at the sound. I took in a deep shaky breath, fighting through the painful lump in my throat and turned to look at Luke standing a few feet away from me.

Luke was staring at my belly that was very prominent and stood out with the pink floral tunic that fell over it softly. He was breathing heavily, hand held out towards me, much like Harry’s was a few days ago. Harry’s hand was held out with a devilish smirk that met his eyes with a glint, it made me feel hot and bothered and ready to jump his bones. Luke’s hand did the opposite. My heart was hammering against my chest as I looked down at his hand, his jaw was tense and I could see behind his eyes that he was doing the math.

Finally, Luke looked up at me, soft ocean blue eyes meeting mine. I couldn’t figure out if he was upset or scared but I knew that I was definitely the latter. “You’re pregnant.”

Luke’s words knocked me out of the stupor I was in and I dropped the basket down to the floor with a clang drawing the eyes of everybody else in the aisle. A had only come in for milk and it burst open as it slipped from the basket. My eyes stung with tears that I really didn’t want to feel now as I stepped back to avoid the rapidly spreading puddle of milk. I dropped down to pick up the other things that I had in my basket but Luke stepped in the way and knocked my hands backwards quickly, picking up the items while a staff member came over to help clean up the spill.

My breath was shaky as I stepped back away while Luke was occupied, apologising profusely to the staff member. I shouldn’t have been walking away from him but my legs were walking towards the door on instinct. I needed to talk this through with him, he could be Nora’s dad and although I didn’t like the idea of it I wouldn’t keep Nora away from him. But I didn’t want to be dealing with this now or in the middle of a grocery store with all the people around, it was lunch time and busier then when Harry and I normally popped in together.

My hands tightened into fists around the soft material of my blouse as I fought the tears that were still lingering at the back of my eyes, fighting to be set free. I was yet to have any tears slip out but I fought them back as well as I could have because I didn’t want to cry over Luke anymore, I had shed to many tears for that man.

“Evie, stop.” Luke hurriedly caught up to me and gently grabbed my arm and pulled me back. I spun into him, the big bump of my belly hitting his stomach and I jolted back away from as if he had thrown a glass of scolding water on me. Luke released my arm with my actions but his eyes were still glued to my belly in a state of surprise. “Why didn’t you call me?”

“I didn’t want to.” My arms circled around my belly protectively. Luke wouldn’t hurt me, at least not physically but I felt like I was about to have a massive anxiety attack at the front door of the grocery store.

Luke raised his hand, pinching the bridge of his nose, eyes squeezing shut. It was something I had seen Harry do since the beginning of the tour whenever Jeff said something to him and he was just too tired to properly process it. There had always been a lot of similarities between Harry and Luke and I felt like they were hitting me hard and right in the face.

They were both always so soft and caring towards me. I had felt so loved and safe with the both of them. They held me when I was sad and talked me through so many of my toughest times. No -matter how good Luke was to me, Harry was always just one step ahead of him which was why I was more drawn to talk to him and why Luke never really liked Harry.

“I know I made a mistake Evie but please don’t punish me like this.” He looked really hurt as his eyes moved over my belly. He stepped closer to me, hand stretching out again but I stepped out of his reach, I didn’t want to feel his hands on my belly.

For the smallest second, I was glad that it was hurting him I wanted him to feel pain. I had hurt for months after what he did to me and it was only recently that I had began to feel like I was getting over it and he barges back into my life and dares to play me as the bad guy in all this. So, for one fraction of a second, I was extremely proud of the crack I saw in his strong exterior because he deserved it.

It was only one small second that was ended with a hard kick to the bottom of my belly where my hand was sat. I shook my head from the thoughts, I just needed to move on from all this, lingering on my hatred of Luke was not moving on. “I can’t do this Luke. Not now, it’s too much.”

Turning away from Luke I walked to my car my hands shaking as I dug through my handbag to find my keys. Everybody was staring at me, eyes soft as I walked away from him, there stares were sympathetic and I wanted to curl up under the pressure of the looks, it couldn’t have been as bad as what Luke felt with the few glares he was receiving.

“You can’t keep my baby away from me.” Luke said strongly from behind me drawing all the eyes to him. Now everybody was glaring at him and they were whispering back and forth. I felt a little reassured to know he wouldn’t do anything to be with audience.

My steps faltered at the small threat that was laced through his voice. I felt sickness turning through my stomach which I hadn’t felt since my first trimester.

Taking a deep breath, I pushed the sickening feeling down as my hand finally found my keys and I got to the driver side door of my car. My hands were still trembling as I got into the driver’s seat, all of me was trembling with what just happened. Out of the corner of my eye I could see that Luke was still stood near the entrance of the store and he was watching me closely.

Luke’s eyes had usually looked at me so softly and with so much care but now his strong stare and tight jaw was intimidating. I felt as if I was on display in a museum under his blue eyes.

There were only a few things I had come to get, a quick pop in and back out of the store but it almost felt like I had spent a year in battle. That one five-minute interaction felt worse than the entire week after our break up. My heart was still beating erratically and Nora was moving like crazy in my belly, the interaction had upset me so much she could feel it as well.

My hands were still shaking terribly as I pulled into my garage next to Harry’s range rover but Nora’s movements had calmed to gentle kicks and pushes against my belly. I still hadn’t cried yet but I could feel the tears dangerously persistent at the back of my eyes. Coming into the warmth and safety of my house and hearing Harry, Grace and Jeff’s voices talking without any worry a few rooms away made the dam that I had held back break loose.

The door to the garage slammed shut behind me and I jumped a mile high at the sharp sound. I didn’t feel right. I felt as if I was on another planet completely and no matter what words I continuously told myself I couldn’t settle the nerves rattling through my chest and shaking through my hands. I couldn’t stop my hands from shaking.

My bag slipped from my arm and to the warm wooden floors with a gentle thud. Desperately my hand reached out to grab the nearest thing I could get my fingers around so I didn’t follow my bag into a scattered mess on the floor.

I’m sorry. I’m so, so sorry. I couldn’t tell who I was apologising to. Luke, Harry, Nora, my parents or even myself I could have apologised to all of them so I just kept repeating it. If I kept apologising then maybe everything would be okay. I needed everything to be okay because I couldn’t bring Nora into a world like this.

“Evie?” Harry said from the other room. “Are you home?” His voice both equally laced with worry and confusion.

I fought to get some words past my lips, anything, to acknowledge him, anything I could get out so I could make him know that I’m here. I wanted to hug myself into his chest and bury myself into the safety that he always provides me. But instead I was stuck in the entrance hall of my house chocking on my words. The only sound I could properly get out was a strangled sob.

“Evie,” Harry repeated again this time the worry outweighing the confusion ten times more.

I heard the sound of a guitar being sat down on a table then the hurried footsteps of numerous people echoing against the wooden floor. My blurred, stinging eyes saw Harry first, he muttered a quick ‘shit’ as he quickly crossed the room, arms already out stretched to catch me if I fell to the floor.

The moment Harry was close enough I released my tight hold from around the doorframe and threw myself into his arms, mine locked around his neck and pulled myself against him and into his warmth as strongly as I could. My sobs were muffled against his black tour hoodie that smelt so strongly of him, I took deep breathes of the intoxicating smell in, trying to comfort myself.

Harry’s hands slid over my hips, my belly, my back, everywhere, anywhere he could get his hands, he was massaging my skin. His warm exploring hands were looking for whatever was hurting me, trying to find a way to make it stop because he hated seeing me cry. But he couldn’t stop the pain I felt on the inside with just his hands.

“What’s wrong, what hurts?” He whispered into my ear, peppering soft kisses against my forehead as he tugged me as close as possible but my belly was already pressed tightly against his and I couldn’t get any closer much to my dislike.

“I want to do the paternity test now.” My hands dug into his hoodie with my words and I buried my face deeper into the material to let it soak up my tears.

Harry tensed with my words and I swear that I heard the stutter of his heartbeat underneath my ear despite the layers of warmth he had on. He slipped his hand up to the back of my neck and gave it a soft squeeze as he pressed a small kiss to the side of my head.

“Breathe for me Evie.” Harry’s voice was tight as he to tried force as much sweetness as he could into the sound. He was angry. I could feel it vibrating off him in scorching waves. I didn’t even have to say Luke’s name and he knew that must have been what had set me off. “Come on breath. Nora can’t have her mummy so stressed out.”

“He wants her.” I whispered trying to get a decent amount of air into my lungs like he had said but I couldn’t. I had to relax first before I could think of getting my breathing straight.

All I wanted was to be here for Nora, she was my main priority. I couldn’t be here for her wholly if I was too caught up trying to move on from Luke. I still hadn’t entirely gotten over him the first time and now he was coming smashing back into my life like a wrecking ball, destroying the feeble walls I had built to protect myself.

“He can’t take her from you Evie. Not anytime soon the best he could do is get visitation, a few hours every week. They won’t take a newborn from her mother.” My chest tightened at the words and I groaned into Harry’s chest. I knew he was right but it wasn’t what I wanted to hear right now.

“I want her to be yours.” Drawing back, I looked up at him, my eyes still blurred and nose a little sniffly.

Harry squeezed my neck again and smiled caringly. “So, do I Eve’s. So do I.”

“He’s going to be so angry with me when he finds out you could be the father.” I groaned and ran a hand over my forehead before burrowing back against his chest, my eyes flicking up to watch him from underneath my wet lashes.

Luke never really liked Harry, almost despised him, because he always thought that he was flirting with me – which maybe he did a bit but that was beside the point. Whenever Harry was around Luke had an arm around my shoulders and was dragging me against his side, glaring over the top of my head in the direction of wherever Harry was stood. I couldn’t blame Harry for not liking Luke but over the last few months, I also couldn’t blame Luke for feeling threatened by Harry but I would have never betrayed my loyalty to Luke and went to Harry behind Luke’s back while we were together. I would have never cheated on him.

Harry’s jaw ticked, hand tightening around my neck while the other twitched over my hip. “You never cheated on him Evie. We didn’t do anything until the two of you were broken up. He has no reason to be angry with you after what he did to you.”

“I really don’t want you to leave now.” I whimpered.

It was only a few weeks until I had him back and could cuddle him close into my arms again but it felt like it was going to be an eternity now. And when I did get him back it wouldn’t be for long before I said goodbye to him again for another few weeks. How did Anne send him off on his first tour and every tour after that, it was to hard to comprehend him leaving even if it was for a short time span.  

Harry sighed, his hands massaging up and down my back again. “Will facetime you every day. Want to see your belly grow.” He kissed over my neck as his hands weaselled there way beneath my blouse and caressing over my hips. “We should go have a nice warm bath together to relax.”

.-.-.-.

“I bought something for Nora today.” Harry said as he climbed up onto the bed at my feet.

His hair was still wet from the bath and curling a bit more around his ears but he looked warm in his tracksuit pants and a different hoodie because I had taken his tour hoodie. He had my bottle of moisturiser in his hands and a white little box that was a mystery to me. Dropping the items down he took my legs and slung them over his, scoching down so he was sat between them, his hands quickly pushing his hoodie up so he could see my bump.

I felt much better after the bath with Harry, he had put lavender oils in the warm water and it worked perfectly against all the hurt in my muscles and the worry in my chest. Having Harry sat behind me was also a great help, his rough fingers dancing patterns in the bubble suds across my belly.

“What?” I asked, eyeing the little box sat near my hip. I still couldn’t tell what the picture on it was. God he better not have gotten me a vibrator.

He smirked at me quickly before grabbing the box, as he opened it the contents fell out on the bed with a little rustle. It was two, little discs with a cord connected to them and I smiled at him realising what exactly it was that he had bought. Definitely not a vibrator. He had a cute little frown on his face as he untangled the chords and read through the instructions quickly before throwing them to the side.

“Adam was telling me he used to play music when Emi was pregnant with Silver and Spike” He said as he stuck the two little discs to either side of my belly. “So I went googleing and found these so Nora can listen to me even when she’s not joining us on tour.”

“What if she wants to listen to Lady Gaga. Maybe ‘born this way’.” I raised my eyebrows at him in jest as I watched him find his phone and plug the cord in to it.

“Well I’d be happy with her anyway she’s born but she needs to hear her daddy’s voice.” A big smile crossed my lips hearing him refer to himself as daddy, Nora’s daddy.

The room was quiet until I heard the soft beginning guitar strums of sweet creature coming for the two little discs. The sound was muted and the little discs vibrated a little against my skin. Harry smiled at my belly, hands caressing the sides of my protruding belly around the discs.

Dropping my hands down I linked my fingers with Harry’s. “We’re going to miss you so much.”

Harry smiled sadly fingers circling my belly while his thumb run over the back of my hand. “Is she kicking?” he asked instead of acknowledging what I said.

“She’s not kicking, but she’s moving.” She was rolling around a bit which she normally wasn’t at this time of day. “You woke her up.”

“Are you sure you don’t want to come with me? I can get you a last-minute flight.” He looked close to tears as he slumped down next to me, quickly cuddling me close, the soft muted sound of sweet creature still playing through the little discs.

Harry flew out tomorrow and as much as I did want to go with him I knew it wasn’t practical even if I wasn’t six months pregnant. Sighing I twisted so I could lean against his chest and get the weight off my back. Harry sighed as well and reached over to hold my belly again, he knew the answer before he even asked.

“Yeah,” he stretched out. “I’ll miss you too.”

I couldn’t stop my hands from shaking.

My bag slipped from my arm and to the warm wooden floors with a gentle thud. Desperately my hand reached out to grab the nearest thing I could get my fingers around so I didn’t follow my bag into a scattered mess on the floor.

I’m sorry. I’m so, so sorry. I couldn’t tell who I was apologising to. Luke, Harry, Nora, my parents or even myself I could have apologised to all of them so I just kept repeating it. If I kept apologising then maybe everything would be okay. I needed everything to be okay because I couldn’t bring Nora into a world like this.

“Evie?” Harry said from the other room. “Are you home?” His voice both equally laced with worry and confusion.

I fought to get some words past my lips, anything, to acknowledge him, anything I could get out so I could make him know that I’m here. I wanted to hug myself into his chest and bury myself into the safety that he always provides me. But instead I was stuck in the entrance hall of my house chocking on my words. The only sound I could properly get out was a strangled sob.

“Evie,” Harry repeated again this time the worry outweighing the confusion ten times more.

I heard the sound of a guitar being sat down on a table then the hurried footsteps of numerous people echoing against the wooden floor. My blurred, stinging eyes saw Harry first, he muttered a quick ‘shit’ as he quickly crossed the room, arms already out stretched to catch me if I fell to the floor.

The moment Harry was close enough I released my tight hold from around the doorframe and threw myself into his arms, mine locked around his neck and pulled myself against him and into his warmth as strongly as I could. My sobs were muffled against his black tour hoodie that smelt so strongly of him, I took deep breathes of the intoxicating smell in, trying to comfort myself.

Harry’s hands slid over my hips, my belly, my back, everywhere, anywhere he could get his hands, he was massaging my skin. His warm exploring hands were looking for whatever was hurting me, trying to find a way to make it stop because he hated seeing me cry. But he couldn’t stop the pain I felt on the inside with just his hands.

“What’s wrong, what hurts?” He whispered into my ear, peppering soft kisses against my forehead as he tugged me as close as possible but my belly was already pressed tightly against his and I couldn’t get any closer much to my dislike.

“I want to do the paternity test now.” My hands dug into his hoodie with my words and I buried my face deeper into the material to let it soak up my tears.

Harry tensed with my words and I swear that I heard the stutter of his heartbeat underneath my ear despite the layers of warmth he had on. He slipped his hand up to the back of my neck and gave it a soft squeeze as he pressed a small kiss to the side of my head.

“Breathe for me Evie.” Harry’s voice was tight as he to tried force as much sweetness as he could into the sound. He was angry. I could feel it vibrating off him in scorching waves. I didn’t even have to say Luke’s name and he knew that must have been what had set me off. “Come on breath. Nora can’t have her mummy so stressed out.”

“He wants her.” I whispered trying to get a decent amount of air into my lungs like he had said but I couldn’t. I had to relax first before I could think of getting my breathing straight.

All I wanted was to be here for Nora, she was my main priority. I couldn’t be here for her wholly if I was too caught up trying to move on from Luke. I still hadn’t entirely gotten over him the first time and now he was coming smashing back into my life like a wrecking ball, destroying the feeble walls I had built to protect myself.

“He can’t take her from you Evie. Not anytime soon the best he could do is get visitation, a few hours every week. They won’t take a newborn from her mother.” My chest tightened at the words and I groaned into Harry’s chest. I knew he was right but it wasn’t what I wanted to hear right now.

“I want her to be yours.” Drawing back, I looked up at him, my eyes still blurred and nose a little sniffly.

Harry squeezed my neck again and smiled caringly. “So, do I Eve’s. So do I.”

“He’s going to be so angry with me when he finds out you could be the father.” I groaned and ran a hand over my forehead before burrowing back against his chest, my eyes flicking up to watch him from underneath my wet lashes.

Luke never really liked Harry, almost despised him, because he always thought that he was flirting with me – which maybe he did a bit but that was beside the point. Whenever Harry was around Luke had an arm around my shoulders and was dragging me against his side, glaring over the top of my head in the direction of wherever Harry was stood. I couldn’t blame Harry for not liking Luke but over the last few months, I also couldn’t blame Luke for feeling threatened by Harry but I would have never betrayed my loyalty to Luke and went to Harry behind Luke’s back while we were together. I would have never cheated on him.

Harry’s jaw ticked, hand tightening around my neck while the other twitched over my hip. “You never cheated on him Evie. We didn’t do anything until the two of you were broken up. He has no reason to be angry with you after what he did to you.”

“I really don’t want you to leave now.” I whimpered.

It was only a few weeks until I had him back and could cuddle him close into my arms again but it felt like it was going to be an eternity now. And when I did get him back it wouldn’t be for long before I said goodbye to him again for another few weeks. How did Anne send him off on his first tour and every tour after that, it was to hard to comprehend him leaving even if it was for a short time span.  

Harry sighed, his hands massaging up and down my back again. “Will facetime you every day. Want to see your belly grow.” He kissed over my neck as his hands weaselled there way beneath my blouse and caressing over my hips. “We should go have a nice warm bath together to relax.”

.-.-.-.

“I bought something for Nora today.” Harry said as he climbed up onto the bed at my feet.

His hair was still wet from the bath and curling a bit more around his ears but he looked warm in his tracksuit pants and a different hoodie because I had taken his tour hoodie. He had my bottle of moisturiser in his hands and a white little box that was a mystery to me. Dropping the items down he took my legs and slung them over his, scoching down so he was sat between them, his hands quickly pushing his hoodie up so he could see my bump.

I felt much better after the bath with Harry, he had put lavender oils in the warm water and it worked perfectly against all the hurt in my muscles and the worry in my chest. Having Harry sat behind me was also a great help, his rough fingers dancing patterns in the bubble suds across my belly.

“What?” I asked, eyeing the little box sat near my hip. I still couldn’t tell what the picture on it was. God he better not have gotten me a vibrator.

He smirked at me quickly before grabbing the box, as he opened it the contents fell out on the bed with a little rustle. It was two, little discs with a cord connected to them and I smiled at him realising what exactly it was that he had bought. Definitely not a vibrator. He had a cute little frown on his face as he untangled the chords and read through the instructions quickly before throwing them to the side.

“Adam was telling me he used to play music when Emi was pregnant with Silver and Spike” He said as he stuck the two little discs to either side of my belly. “So I went googleing and found these so Nora can listen to me even when she’s not joining us on tour.”

“What if she wants to listen to Lady Gaga. Maybe ‘born this way’.” I raised my eyebrows at him in jest as I watched him find his phone and plug the cord in to it.

“Well I’d be happy with her anyway she’s born but she needs to hear her daddy’s voice.” A big smile crossed my lips hearing him refer to himself as daddy, Nora’s daddy.

The room was quiet until I heard the soft beginning guitar strums of sweet creature coming for the two little discs. The sound was muted and the little discs vibrated a little against my skin. Harry smiled at my belly, hands caressing the sides of my protruding belly around the discs.

Dropping my hands down I linked my fingers with Harry’s. “We’re going to miss you so much.”

Harry smiled sadly fingers circling my belly while his thumb run over the back of my hand. “Is she kicking?” he asked instead of acknowledging what I said.

“She’s not kicking, but she’s moving.” She was rolling around a bit which she normally wasn’t at this time of day. “You woke her up.”

“Are you sure you don’t want to come with me? I can get you a last-minute flight.” He looked close to tears as he slumped down next to me, quickly cuddling me close, the soft muted sound of sweet creature still playing through the little discs.

Harry flew out tomorrow and as much as I did want to go with him I knew it wasn’t practical even if I wasn’t six months pregnant. Sighing I twisted so I could lean against his chest and get the weight off my back. Harry sighed as well and reached over to hold my belly again, he knew the answer before he even asked.

“Yeah,” he stretched out. “I’ll miss you too.”

“We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.” ― Oscar Wilde, Lady Windermere’s Fan

Grocery shopping had become much more difficult now that I was pregnant. I felt much more pressured and aware of what I was putting in my body and passing on to Nora. Albeit it was much, much easier when I didn’t have Harry two steps behind me reminding me that I couldn’t eat whatever I set my eyes on.

We always made our trips to the grocery store early in the morning, when the aisles were dead and the only people lingering were the few other early risers and the staff who looked like they wished they were still at home in their warm beds. It made it easier so we weren’t pictured by fans or any paparazzi.

[[MORE]]

My pregnancy was still a secret between us and our closest friends and family. It was a surprise because I had been in the crowd at all of his European shows and there were a number of pictures being shared of me being there, curious as to why I was at so many shows and what was going on between us, but no one had commented on my belly. I had managed to hide it beneath loose dark shirts and cardigans and the dark arena also massively helped but there was still that one perfectly timed picture where the bump was quite visible and there were a few rumours that were quickly overshadowed by something Harry had done on stage that night.

Picking up a little tub of a cheese dip from the fridge I smiled at the fond memory the spurted at the front of my mind.

Harry pulled the cold cheese dip from my hand and put it back into the fridge, vehemently ignoring the glare I shot at him. “You can’t eat that. It’s bad for Nora.”

 

Leaning forward I picked it back up and swerved away from Harry and his big hands as he tried to take it from me again, a daring smirk stretching his beautiful pink lips. He pressed himself up against my back, the warmth from his body somehow seeping through my jacket and against my skin. The heat reminded me of what he had woken me up with only an hour ago and I felt my cheeks erupt with warmth.

 

“Put the cheese down.” He murmured into my ear, teeth nipping lightly as he squeezed my hips.

 

Ignoring the scolding heat of him I lifted the little tub of cheese up and put my finger on one of the ingredients displayed on the packaging and held it up close to him so he could see it. “Pasteurised milk. It’s fine.”

 

“Evie,” Harry frowned against my ear and tried to grab it from me again but I twisted out of his reach and clutched the cool cheese to my chest in protection. I wanted cheese and I was going to have it. “It’s still not healthy.”

 

“I’m pregnant and hungry. Don’t mess with my cheese.” He shook his head and smiled loving at me, hand reaching out to take the cheese so he could put it in the trolley for me.

 

Shaking my head, I stuck my tongue out and kept walking up the aisle, one hand holding my cheese to my chest while the other caressed over my belly as Nora started to kick. I heard Harry chuckle quietly. “Swear I won’t put it back Eve’s. Just don’t want you to make it warm holding onto it.” Pursing my lips, I turned to look back at him. His hand was still out, slowly I passed it over to him, keeping my eyes on him till he dropped it into the baby seat of the trolley where I could see it clearly. “You’re lucky I love you.”

 

“Well I love cheese.” I had almost gotten to the end of the aisle when Harry snuck up behind me his hands tickling my sides.

 

I laughed hard, trying to twist out of his hold but he just looped his arms around my waist completely to pull me into him, his lips silencing my laugh. He kissed me heavily, right in the middle of the grocery store despite his own words to keep PDA non-existent, his hands sliding from my hips to cup my ass in his hands.

 

“I love you,” he whispered against my lips, still caressing them lightly with his own.

 

“I love you too, though I think you made me pee a little.” Harry laughed lightly and I crossed my legs a little, trying to fight off laughing again.

I thought that we were close before but somehow after one night, with love declarations and some great sex, we were like one. I couldn’t explain but I had never felt so right. My life had never felt so perfect and moving in the right direction despite the little detour of Nora. I felt a way that I never had with Luke. I had never been even a fraction close to real love with Luke now that I knew what it was like to truly love Harry.

He was sat on my couch at home talking over some last-minute things with Jeff but already I missed him so much. “We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.” ― Oscar Wilde, Lady Windermere’s Fan

Grocery shopping had become much more difficult now that I was pregnant. I felt much more pressured and aware of what I was putting in my body and passing on to Nora. Albeit it was much, much easier when I didn’t have Harry two steps behind me reminding me that I couldn’t eat whatever I set my eyes on.

We always made our trips to the grocery store early in the morning, when the aisles were dead and the only people lingering were the few other early risers and the staff who looked like they wished they were still at home in their warm beds. It made it easier so we weren’t pictured by fans or any paparazzi.

My pregnancy was still a secret between us and our closest friends and family. It was a surprise because I had been in the crowd at all of his European shows and there were a number of pictures being shared of me being there, curious as to why I was at so many shows and what was going on between us, but no one had commented on my belly. I had managed to hide it beneath loose dark shirts and cardigans and the dark arena also massively helped but there was still that one perfectly timed picture where the bump was quite visible and there were a few rumours that were quickly overshadowed by something Harry had done on stage that night.

Picking up a little tub of a cheese dip from the fridge I smiled at the fond memory the spurted at the front of my mind.

Harry pulled the cold cheese dip from my hand and put it back into the fridge, vehemently ignoring the glare I shot at him. “You can’t eat that. It’s bad for Nora.”

 

Leaning forward I picked it back up and swerved away from Harry and his big hands as he tried to take it from me again, a daring smirk stretching his beautiful pink lips. He pressed himself up against my back, the warmth from his body somehow seeping through my jacket and against my skin. The heat reminded me of what he had woken me up with only an hour ago and I felt my cheeks erupt with warmth.

 

“Put the cheese down.” He murmured into my ear, teeth nipping lightly as he squeezed my hips.

 

Ignoring the scolding heat of him I lifted the little tub of cheese up and put my finger on one of the ingredients displayed on the packaging and held it up close to him so he could see it. “Pasteurised milk. It’s fine.”

 

“Evie,” Harry frowned against my ear and tried to grab it from me again but I twisted out of his reach and clutched the cool cheese to my chest in protection. I wanted cheese and I was going to have it. “It’s still not healthy.”

 

“I’m pregnant and hungry. Don’t mess with my cheese.” He shook his head and smiled loving at me, hand reaching out to take the cheese so he could put it in the trolley for me.

 

Shaking my head, I stuck my tongue out and kept walking up the aisle, one hand holding my cheese to my chest while the other caressed over my belly as Nora started to kick. I heard Harry chuckle quietly. “Swear I won’t put it back Eve’s. Just don’t want you to make it warm holding onto it.” Pursing my lips, I turned to look back at him. His hand was still out, slowly I passed it over to him, keeping my eyes on him till he dropped it into the baby seat of the trolley where I could see it clearly. “You’re lucky I love you.”

 

“Well I love cheese.” I had almost gotten to the end of the aisle when Harry snuck up behind me his hands tickling my sides.

 

I laughed hard, trying to twist out of his hold but he just looped his arms around my waist completely to pull me into him, his lips silencing my laugh. He kissed me heavily, right in the middle of the grocery store despite his own words to keep PDA non-existent, his hands sliding from my hips to cup my ass in his hands.

 

“I love you,” he whispered against my lips, still caressing them lightly with his own.

 

“I love you too, though I think you made me pee a little.” Harry laughed lightly and I crossed my legs a little, trying to fight off laughing again.

I chuckled as I slipped the new tub of cheese into my basket. Somehow Harry and I had become closer after the last few weekends. I thought that we were close before but somehow after one night, with love declarations and some great sex, we were like one. I couldn’t explain but I had never felt so right. My life had never felt so perfect and moving in the right direction despite the little detour of Nora. I felt a way that I never had with Luke. I had never been even a fraction close to real love with Luke now that I knew what it was like to truly love Harry.

I sighed deeply as I continued up the aisles. Harry was leaving for a few weeks and I had already felt so lost just thinking about him going. He was sat on my couch at home talking over some last-minute things with Jeff but already I missed him so much. He was also a little annoyed that I wasn’t going to go with him on the next two legs of the tour but Australia seemed a little too far away if something were to go wrong.

I would be fine without him. I had Anne and Gemma in London with me and Grace every few weeks when she flew back from New York, but they didn’t compare to Harry. Harry was always the one I talked to. For years he was the one that I called first when I just needed to talk. Even when I was with Luke I would rather talk to Harry.

When I got home for the hospital after my parents died I left Luke asleep in my bed, snoring his head off while I snuck downstairs, Harry’s number already dialled on my phone. I sat outside talking to him on my back deck until the sun rose behind the trees. Then I didn’t think it was a bad thing but now I realised if it was Harry that he been in my bed that night and not Luke, he wouldn’t have fallen asleep, he would have stayed awake peppering my neck with kisses and letting me talk until I fell asleep in his arms.

“Evie,” the voice was soft, the gentlest tone I had ever heard leave his mouth, but the single word was still laced with shock.

My chest tightened incredibly and I had to reach out my hand to steady myself on one of the shelves. I knew that voice, it was a voice that I loved and still leaves me trembling at the sound. I took in a deep shaky breath, fighting through the painful lump in my throat and turned to look at Luke standing a few feet away from me.

Luke was staring at my belly that was very prominent and stood out with the pink floral tunic that fell over it softly. He was breathing heavily, hand held out towards me, much like Harry’s was a few days ago. Harry’s hand was held out with a devilish smirk that met his eyes with a glint, it made me feel hot and bothered and ready to jump his bones. Luke’s hand did the opposite. My heart was hammering against my chest as I looked down at his hand, his jaw was tense and I could see behind his eyes that he was doing the math.

Finally, Luke looked up at me, soft ocean blue eyes meeting mine. I couldn’t figure out if he was upset or scared but I knew that I was definitely the latter. “You’re pregnant.”

Luke’s words knocked me out of the stupor I was in and I dropped the basket down to the floor with a clang drawing the eyes of everybody else in the aisle. A had only come in for milk and it burst open as it slipped from the basket. My eyes stung with tears that I really didn’t want to feel now as I stepped back to avoid the rapidly spreading puddle of milk. I dropped down to pick up the other things that I had in my basket but Luke stepped in the way and knocked my hands backwards quickly, picking up the items while a staff member came over to help clean up the spill.

My breath was shaky as I stepped back away while Luke was occupied, apologising profusely to the staff member. I shouldn’t have been walking away from him but my legs were walking towards the door on instinct. I needed to talk this through with him, he could be Nora’s dad and although I didn’t like the idea of it I wouldn’t keep Nora away from him. But I didn’t want to be dealing with this now or in the middle of a grocery store with all the people around, it was lunch time and busier then when Harry and I normally popped in together.

My hands tightened into fists around the soft material of my blouse as I fought the tears that were still lingering at the back of my eyes, fighting to be set free. I was yet to have any tears slip out but I fought them back as well as I could have because I didn’t want to cry over Luke anymore, I had shed to many tears for that man.

“Evie, stop.” Luke hurriedly caught up to me and gently grabbed my arm and pulled me back. I spun into him, the big bump of my belly hitting his stomach and I jolted back away from as if he had thrown a glass of scolding water on me. Luke released my arm with my actions but his eyes were still glued to my belly in a state of surprise. “Why didn’t you call me?”

“I didn’t want to.” My arms circled around my belly protectively. Luke wouldn’t hurt me, at least not physically but I felt like I was about to have a massive anxiety attack at the front door of the grocery store.

Luke raised his hand, pinching the bridge of his nose, eyes squeezing shut. It was something I had seen Harry do since the beginning of the tour whenever Jeff said something to him and he was just too tired to properly process it. There had always been a lot of similarities between Harry and Luke and I felt like they were hitting me hard and right in the face.

They were both always so soft and caring towards me. I had felt so loved and safe with the both of them. They held me when I was sad and talked me through so many of my toughest times. No -matter how good Luke was to me, Harry was always just one step ahead of him which was why I was more drawn to talk to him and why Luke never really liked Harry.

“I know I made a mistake Evie but please don’t punish me like this.” He looked really hurt as his eyes moved over my belly. He stepped closer to me, hand stretching out again but I stepped out of his reach, I didn’t want to feel his hands on my belly.

For the smallest second, I was glad that it was hurting him I wanted him to feel pain. I had hurt for months after what he did to me and it was only recently that I had began to feel like I was getting over it and he barges back into my life and dares to play me as the bad guy in all this. So, for one fraction of a second, I was extremely proud of the crack I saw in his strong exterior because he deserved it.

It was only one small second that was ended with a hard kick to the bottom of my belly where my hand was sat. I shook my head from the thoughts, I just needed to move on from all this, lingering on my hatred of Luke was not moving on. “I can’t do this Luke. Not now, it’s too much.”

Turning away from Luke I walked to my car my hands shaking as I dug through my handbag to find my keys. Everybody was staring at me, eyes soft as I walked away from him, there stares were sympathetic and I wanted to curl up under the pressure of the looks, it couldn’t have been as bad as what Luke felt with the few glares he was receiving.

“You can’t keep my baby away from me.” Luke said strongly from behind me drawing all the eyes to him. Now everybody was glaring at him and they were whispering back and forth. I felt a little reassured to know he wouldn’t do anything to be with audience.

My steps faltered at the small threat that was laced through his voice. I felt sickness turning through my stomach which I hadn’t felt since my first trimester.

Taking a deep breath, I pushed the sickening feeling down as my hand finally found my keys and I got to the driver side door of my car. My hands were still trembling as I got into the driver’s seat, all of me was trembling with what just happened. Out of the corner of my eye I could see that Luke was still stood near the entrance of the store and he was watching me closely.

Luke’s eyes had usually looked at me so softly and with so much care but now his strong stare and tight jaw was intimidating. I felt as if I was on display in a museum under his blue eyes.

There were only a few things I had come to get, a quick pop in and back out of the store but it almost felt like I had spent a year in battle. That one five-minute interaction felt worse than the entire week after our break up. My heart was still beating erratically and Nora was moving like crazy in my belly, the interaction had upset me so much she could feel it as well.

My hands were still shaking terribly as I pulled into my garage next to Harry’s range rover but Nora’s movements had calmed to gentle kicks and pushes against my belly. I still hadn’t cried yet but I could feel the tears dangerously persistent at the back of my eyes. Coming into the warmth and safety of my house and hearing Harry, Grace and Jeff’s voices talking without any worry a few rooms away made the dam that I had held back break loose.

The door to the garage slammed shut behind me and I jumped a mile high at the sharp sound. I didn’t feel right. I felt as if I was on another planet completely and no matter what words I continuously told myself I couldn’t settle the nerves rattling through my chest and shaking through my hands. I couldn’t stop my hands from shaking.

My bag slipped from my arm and to the warm wooden floors with a gentle thud. Desperately my hand reached out to grab the nearest thing I could get my fingers around so I didn’t follow my bag into a scattered mess on the floor.

I’m sorry. I’m so, so sorry. I couldn’t tell who I was apologising to. Luke, Harry, Nora, my parents or even myself I could have apologised to all of them so I just kept repeating it. If I kept apologising then maybe everything would be okay. I needed everything to be okay because I couldn’t bring Nora into a world like this.

“Evie?” Harry said from the other room. “Are you home?” His voice both equally laced with worry and confusion.

I fought to get some words past my lips, anything, to acknowledge him, anything I could get out so I could make him know that I’m here. I wanted to hug myself into his chest and bury myself into the safety that he always provides me. But instead I was stuck in the entrance hall of my house chocking on my words. The only sound I could properly get out was a strangled sob.

“Evie,” Harry repeated again this time the worry outweighing the confusion ten times more.

I heard the sound of a guitar being sat down on a table then the hurried footsteps of numerous people echoing against the wooden floor. My blurred, stinging eyes saw Harry first, he muttered a quick ‘shit’ as he quickly crossed the room, arms already out stretched to catch me if I fell to the floor.

The moment Harry was close enough I released my tight hold from around the doorframe and threw myself into his arms, mine locked around his neck and pulled myself against him and into his warmth as strongly as I could. My sobs were muffled against his black tour hoodie that smelt so strongly of him, I took deep breathes of the intoxicating smell in, trying to comfort myself.

Harry’s hands slid over my hips, my belly, my back, everywhere, anywhere he could get his hands, he was massaging my skin. His warm exploring hands were looking for whatever was hurting me, trying to find a way to make it stop because he hated seeing me cry. But he couldn’t stop the pain I felt on the inside with just his hands.

“What’s wrong, what hurts?” He whispered into my ear, peppering soft kisses against my forehead as he tugged me as close as possible but my belly was already pressed tightly against his and I couldn’t get any closer much to my dislike.

“I want to do the paternity test now.” My hands dug into his hoodie with my words and I buried my face deeper into the material to let it soak up my tears.

Harry tensed with my words and I swear that I heard the stutter of his heartbeat underneath my ear despite the layers of warmth he had on. He slipped his hand up to the back of my neck and gave it a soft squeeze as he pressed a small kiss to the side of my head.

“Breathe for me Evie.” Harry’s voice was tight as he to tried force as much sweetness as he could into the sound. He was angry. I could feel it vibrating off him in scorching waves. I didn’t even have to say Luke’s name and he knew that must have been what had set me off. “Come on breath. Nora can’t have her mummy so stressed out.”

“He wants her.” I whispered trying to get a decent amount of air into my lungs like he had said but I couldn’t. I had to relax first before I could think of getting my breathing straight.

All I wanted was to be here for Nora, she was my main priority. I couldn’t be here for her wholly if I was too caught up trying to move on from Luke. I still hadn’t entirely gotten over him the first time and now he was coming smashing back into my life like a wrecking ball, destroying the feeble walls I had built to protect myself.

“He can’t take her from you Evie. Not anytime soon the best he could do is get visitation, a few hours every week. They won’t take a newborn from her mother.” My chest tightened at the words and I groaned into Harry’s chest. I knew he was right but it wasn’t what I wanted to hear right now.

“I want her to be yours.” Drawing back, I looked up at him, my eyes still blurred and nose a little sniffly.

Harry squeezed my neck again and smiled caringly. “So, do I Eve’s. So do I.”

“He’s going to be so angry with me when he finds out you could be the father.” I groaned and ran a hand over my forehead before burrowing back against his chest, my eyes flicking up to watch him from underneath my wet lashes.

Luke never really liked Harry, almost despised him, because he always thought that he was flirting with me – which maybe he did a bit but that was beside the point. Whenever Harry was around Luke had an arm around my shoulders and was dragging me against his side, glaring over the top of my head in the direction of wherever Harry was stood. I couldn’t blame Harry for not liking Luke but over the last few months, I also couldn’t blame Luke for feeling threatened by Harry but I would have never betrayed my loyalty to Luke and went to Harry behind Luke’s back while we were together. I would have never cheated on him.

Harry’s jaw ticked, hand tightening around my neck while the other twitched over my hip. “You never cheated on him Evie. We didn’t do anything until the two of you were broken up. He has no reason to be angry with you after what he did to you.”

“I really don’t want you to leave now.” I whimpered.

It was only a few weeks until I had him back and could cuddle him close into my arms again but it felt like it was going to be an eternity now. And when I did get him back it wouldn’t be for long before I said goodbye to him again for another few weeks. How did Anne send him off on his first tour and every tour after that, it was to hard to comprehend him leaving even if it was for a short time span.  

Harry sighed, his hands massaging up and down my back again. “Will facetime you every day. Want to see your belly grow.” He kissed over my neck as his hands weaselled there way beneath my blouse and caressing over my hips. “We should go have a nice warm bath together to relax.”

.-.-.-.

“I bought something for Nora today.” Harry said as he climbed up onto the bed at my feet.

His hair was still wet from the bath and curling a bit more around his ears but he looked warm in his tracksuit pants and a different hoodie because I had taken his tour hoodie. He had my bottle of moisturiser in his hands and a white little box that was a mystery to me. Dropping the items down he took my legs and slung them over his, scoching down so he was sat between them, his hands quickly pushing his hoodie up so he could see my bump.

I felt much better after the bath with Harry, he had put lavender oils in the warm water and it worked perfectly against all the hurt in my muscles and the worry in my chest. Having Harry sat behind me was also a great help, his rough fingers dancing patterns in the bubble suds across my belly.

“What?” I asked, eyeing the little box sat near my hip. I still couldn’t tell what the picture on it was. God he better not have gotten me a vibrator.

He smirked at me quickly before grabbing the box, as he opened it the contents fell out on the bed with a little rustle. It was two, little discs with a cord connected to them and I smiled at him realising what exactly it was that he had bought. Definitely not a vibrator. He had a cute little frown on his face as he untangled the chords and read through the instructions quickly before throwing them to the side.

“Adam was telling me he used to play music when Emi was pregnant with Silver and Spike” He said as he stuck the two little discs to either side of my belly. “So I went googleing and found these so Nora can listen to me even when she’s not joining us on tour.”

“What if she wants to listen to Lady Gaga. Maybe ‘born this way’.” I raised my eyebrows at him in jest as I watched him find his phone and plug the cord in to it.

“Well I’d be happy with her anyway she’s born but she needs to hear her daddy’s voice.” A big smile crossed my lips hearing him refer to himself as daddy, Nora’s daddy.

The room was quiet until I heard the soft beginning guitar strums of sweet creature coming for the two little discs. The sound was muted and the little discs vibrated a little against my skin. Harry smiled at my belly, hands caressing the sides of my protruding belly around the discs.

Dropping my hands down I linked my fingers with Harry’s. “We’re going to miss you so much.”

Harry smiled sadly fingers circling my belly while his thumb run over the back of my hand. “Is she kicking?” he asked instead of acknowledging what I said.

“She’s not kicking, but she’s moving.” She was rolling around a bit which she normally wasn’t at this time of day. “You woke her up.”

“Are you sure you don’t want to come with me? I can get you a last-minute flight.” He looked close to tears as he slumped down next to me, quickly cuddling me close, the soft muted sound of sweet creature still playing through the little discs.

Harry flew out tomorrow and as much as I did want to go with him I knew it wasn’t practical even if I wasn’t six months pregnant. Sighing I twisted so I could lean against his chest and get the weight off my back. Harry sighed as well and reached over to hold my belly again, he knew the answer before he even asked.

“Yeah,” he stretched out. “I’ll miss you too.”
